website_summaries.verdict: The Acer C720 (C720-2800) comes closer to Chromebook nirvana, but we still haven't reached that level yet. It's a couple of tweaks from being the perfect low cost bridge between mobile device and full-fledged laptop.
cons: Chrome OS offers limited offline use

customer_reviews.title: Really Good for the Price!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Chromebook for my 17 year old daughter as a backup to her main HP laptop because it's lighter to carry around school. She’s a dual enrollment student with a local college and this was perfect for her. I’ve done some web searches and video streaming and noticed that it’s really fast. It’s much faster than her regular laptop. It also boots up extremely fast as well. The OS is very clean looking. This was our first experience with using the Google Chrome OS. I’m overall very happy with this purchase and so is she!
customer_reviews.author: L.C

customer_reviews.title: chromebook
customer_reviews.text: if ur on a budget and need a working computer for an affordable price than this is a great one to get the battery last pretty long don't expect this to be a heavy gaming computer or a computer for editing you can't download things like photoshop or gimp either but it is good for the basic things like lightly surfing the web typing up a paper or doing research as well has watching netflix on watching youtube and listening to music the sound is just ur basic quality sound that you would find in any smaller computers. it's worth the price
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Stacy

customer_reviews.title: died after a month
customer_reviews.text: This computer died after a month of having it. I tried to contact the seller on several occasions and no response at all. The computer was for our daughter for school so at christmas time, we had to go out and buy another computer to replace this one. That was not a pleasant experience to say the least. I would not recommend this product or the seller. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: amber

customer_reviews.title: Great value with good performance
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Chromebook and you can't beat the value if you know what you're getting into. This is a great computer for surfing the web and using online tools, it boots extremely quickly and runs fast. The most processor intensive tasks I use it for are web based photo editing and streaming videos, and for those tasks it is perfect. It's best to research the Chrome OS before buying and understand that you won't be installing programs like you would with a PC, but for this price, what you get is great.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Moon

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, not a great battery life.
customer_reviews.text: I love Chromebooks, and this is a very good one, but the battery life isn't great compared to what I was using (by Hisense). Also, for whatever reason, this isn't recognized by the Play store as something you can load Android apps on (again, unlike my old Hisense). But most people don't need a Chromebook for anything other than the browser, and that works great.
customer_reviews.author: Zak Druzba

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality
customer_reviews.text: It's delivered an1n hour ago. When the package is opened, one key comes off, and the upper left corner chopped off, as shown in the pictures. It's very worn and dirty. Can't imagine how someone could re-sell it, even thought it's marked as re-'newed'. There is certainly neither 're-' nor 'newed.'
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy with my purchase, one year later :)
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these about a year ago, and have been extremely happy with the device. My latest purchase, however, the Chromebook 11 from Acer is a big disappointment. It hangs, reboots, and suffers from other ailments. I sent it back as defective. As of lately, given the most recent software updates, all my chromebooks are now running slow. I'm back to using my MacBook Pro :(
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong!
customer_reviews.text: A laptop for around a $100.00, I bought my first chromebook for around $82, refurbished of course, and I love it. Bought another one for my wife. If you need it to cruise around the net and maybe some simple word processing this is all you need. Although I think they have open office apps that you can install as well. I also downloaded Spotify. The other great thing is you never need to worry about viruses or malware. I've never encountered a single problem since I've owned one.
customer_reviews.author: hpnice

customer_reviews.title: Can't put it down
customer_reviews.text: As Linux/OSS developer I wanted to try a consumer device that is putting Linux on the desktop today. The keyboard is awesome, along with the build of the whole laptop. I find my self comparing it to my T series Thinkpads. The laptop can be rooted and run anything you want but I am finding that Google is doing a good job with the user happiness. I am using it 6+ hours a day and love the 8+ hour battery life. I also got a Nexus 7 to test consumer tablets and find that I am using the Chromebook more. Lots of tech for ~$500 and great for LUG and other meetings.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Latham

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy from this seller
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a birthday gift for my 9 year old and just as soon as she gets all her info in and starts playing on it, the mouse stops working. It isn't touchscreen, so therefore she could not do anything. On top of this, it was very scratched up and this was not in the description when I purchased. Very disappointed and now have a very upset little girl.
customer_reviews.author: Kally S Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Did not connect to wifi consistently
customer_reviews.text: This product was a waste of money. It wouldn't consistently connect to the wifi regardless if you were standing next to the wifi itself or in another part of the home. We bought it for our daughter because that Chromebook is what the school loaned to students to write their papers and such on campus. We thought it would be easy for her to just have her own, but it never worked properly and with a Chromebook it is worthless if it won't connect to the internet.
customer_reviews.author: C_Ashlie

customer_reviews.title: Would Definitely Buy Acer Again
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about this Chromebook, which I got to replace my Samsung Chromebook that was trashed in a bike spill. Some on-line reviews said the Acer C720 touch pad was lackluster, but I can't see anything at all wrong with it. I like the feel of the keyboard. Has excellent battery capacity. Charges fast. Maybe there are better screens, but the screen on this Chromebook is good enough for me, even for photo viewing. All in all, really glad I got it. If I crash again and destroy this one, I am getting another C720 to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: OSFarmDoc

customer_reviews.title: Chromebook C720 a keeper
customer_reviews.text: I love my new Chromebook! I am able to use Google for all my word processing needs, Kindle app for reading and the battery life is wonderful! I am able to do everything I normally do on the computer all on this device; search the web, emails, pictures, Netflix, Kindle. I borrow eBooks from the public library and sometimes have to transfer them on my Kindle via USB port so I was concerned I would not be able to download them and transfer them, but it was not a problem! I still smile at myself when I turn the Chromebook on because I am waiting for it to load but it doesn't need to, it is always available! Great device!
customer_reviews.author: Happy Reader

customer_reviews.title: It has a great battery life and boots in seconds
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Chromebook in Nov. of 2013, so it's been 1 yr. 2 months of use. My family uses it every day for several hours. It has a great battery life and boots in seconds. Fast browsing, good durability, and good sound/picture. Using google drive with google sheets and google docs takes care of my small business needs. The only major drawback is printing. You can only print using Google Cloud print, and that will only work if you have another computer that is wirelessly connected to the printer with Windows. It simply is not possible to print without that setup, which makes this computer almost perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Brahm13

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING VALUE
customer_reviews.text: I have had the C720 for a couple of weeks and the more I use it the better I like it. I am very happy with the quality of the componets and their functionality. The keyboard is a little different than the standard keyboard. But this has not been a problem and some of the differences are an improvement. I also bought a Chromecast a few weeks before I bought the C720 and they really work well together. I do not see how anyone could go wrong buying one of these little guys. It has certainly exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: D. E. Mathias

customer_reviews.title: Dead battery
customer_reviews.text: The computer arrived and I was excited. It had some visible damage but it was listed as used so I can not really complain. The battery is completely dead so it doesn't turn on unless it is plugged in. Completely defeats the purpose of a laptop which is why I bought it. It is a shame they do not have better quality control and test batteries before they sell this junk. I give it 2 stars because it was such a cheap computer. Other than that, spend a few dollars more because you are going to have to replace the battery anyways, might as well get a better computer.....
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: great computer great price!
customer_reviews.text: I received the chromebook 2 weeks ago and absolutely love, love it! I'm not that tech saavy but was able to set the computer up easily by myself as well as transferring my music from itunes to the cloud. It is so so fast compared to my lenovo notebook. I am on it for hours and it barely gets warm. Picture quality is great for viewing movies and the sound is awesome. It was out of stock for several days before I received it-now I understand why. A fantastic, easy to use computer at a great price. Grab one while you can.
customer_reviews.author: jes

customer_reviews.title: So easy for the web
customer_reviews.text: I just love this thing. I use lots of devices - Windows phones, Android tablets, Windows laptops, linux pc etc - but this is my fave. If you use a laptop for going online, get a Chromebook. They don't slow down like win machines, they're simple, lightweight, and have great battery time. There are a ton of free apps and extensions available (Autodesk's Pixlr is awesome). When my wife's laptop dies I'll get her one of these too. I was dubious about the cloud printing, but even that works well, and cloud printers are so cheap. I'm a convert.
customer_reviews.author: P. Heald

customer_reviews.title: Everything works fantastically, did come with minor scratches
customer_reviews.text: Great product. To be honest, my money was well spent on this chromebook. The chromebook did come with some minor scratches but everything seems to be working phenomenally!! I would definitely recommend this product to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Ban-Jian

customer_reviews.title: I own nine computers, and I use this more than all the other ones put together.
customer_reviews.text: I had a Samsung Chromebook, and I liked it, but it wasn't as snappy as I needed. This ACER (I have the 4GB, but my brother has the 2GB and I don't notice a difference) flies. I like it more than my MacBook Pro, my Windows laptop and my windows desktop. Being productive and in the cloud is such a convenience. There is very little I can't do with it; I highly recommend a Chromebook. The Haswell processor is what makes this so blazing fast. I'd also recommend the Chromecast for your TV/projector. Chromebook + Chromecast = greatness.
customer_reviews.author: corydave

customer_reviews.title: Best of the low end laptops
customer_reviews.text: Nice unit with lots of RAM to allow the browser to fly. The additional 2 USB ports allowed us to plug in external keyboard and mouse. The HDMI port allowed us to connect an HDMI to VGA adapter to our older VGA monitor. Makes a wonderful secondary workstation in the home office, and functions as a very light portable. Great for checking/responding to emails during the evening - boots up within a few seconds. Highly recommended especially at this price.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Goldstein

customer_reviews.title: Improvement over Samsung Chromebook. Solid, does the job. Not luxuriuous.
customer_reviews.text: I use Chromebooks as my main day laptop; mostly email, browsing, writing stuff. I moved from the ARM-based Samsung Chromebook to this Intel based C720. So far the difference in performance is noticeable. The made is cheap but less than the Samsung. Feels very plastic, but is solid and well made. Screen is good and battery life is fantastic. Track pad is a little too noisy but no big deal. Speakers are good. Very good buy for a cheap, chromebook for day-to-day stuff. UPDATE: Battery life is fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: RST1

customer_reviews.title: Awesome.
customer_reviews.text: 8 hour battery life, light weight, great keyboard, great speakers, great Wifi connection speed, great SD card slot, great touchpad, great keyboard shortcuts. This computer is fast, efficient, and good-looking. If you want a device to game on or do heavy movie editing on, this is not for you. But if you need something FAST that you can check your email on and write documents with, this is your computer. You'd be hard-pressed to find better value for the price. $250 for the 4gb model.
customer_reviews.author: Vikram

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Cheap Portable Laptop
customer_reviews.text: I love this laptop. Powerful, great battery life, and it's cheap enough that I don't mind taking it on trips and throwing it in a bag. I was able to get Arch linux installed natively on the drive with SeaBIOS and it worked well, but I decided to revert back to the stock Chrome OS and blew away Arch in the end. I felt like the native OS gave me better battery life. Either way, solid machine. I like the feel of the keys. The mousepad feels a little cheap, but it's good enough that it doesn't bother me.
customer_reviews.author: will

customer_reviews.title: Great for installing Linux!
customer_reviews.text: What a fantastic little ultraportable this machine is! I upgraded to an aftermarket 128GB SSD, and then installed Xubuntu 13.10. With a little tweaking (thanks to a GREAT little guide on reddit), this machine is now a super fast, super light, ultraportable linux machine that goes whereever I do, and does pretty much anything I want it to. AND, With the new linux version of the Chrome browser installed, I don't even have to give up on any of the few cool things about ChromeOS...
customer_reviews.author: Isaac

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend for younger crowd
customer_reviews.text: My Lil' brother had this talk about purchasing a high end laptop that does "this" and "that". He started to name big brands like Mac or Windows based with a i7. I've done my research for a productive and/or functional laptop, so ended up myself purchasinng a chromebook (C720) for him. He wouldn't get off of the laptop after he started using it. Compared to the c7 the 720 was the better choice. -Running time for battery life was doubled -Faster performing processor -Great price It was a laptop worth buying
customer_reviews.author: PShadow

customer_reviews.title: Does the job it was bought for to study online
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I do not like is the fact that it cannot power on by itself when it is been plugged out
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: This thing works great!
customer_reviews.text: So far my only real complaint about this is the screen kinda stinks. It doesn't do well at angles and I find myself having to adjust it a lot. Beyond that this Chromebook is awesome. Everything runs great on it and I've side loaded Linux onto an SD card and I'm able to run a decent amount of games from Steam. 1080p videos play flawlessly via streaming or USB. It does have some limited codec support though.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Higgins

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for online school
customer_reviews.text: My daughter’s Chromebook stopped working about midway through online learning due to Covid-19 school closures. I was hesitant to buy “preowned” electronics, but was desperate and everything reasonably priced was sold out. I’m very happy with this purchase! It works great and looks practically brand new. I definitely recommend this seller and would not hesitate to buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh Ann Dixon

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Device for a Bargain Price
customer_reviews.text: It's important to familiarize yourself with a chromebook before getting one. But if you know what you're getting to, this chromebook is great for the price. The intel celeron processor is a weak processor in general, but for a light OS such as the Chrome OS, it runs crazy fast. And with the 4GB of RAM, this chromebook can open webpages without a hiccup. It can easily run 20 tabs of webpages without stuttering. The speed of a chromebook is on par with other laptops that cost 5 times as much.
customer_reviews.author: Rich T

customer_reviews.title: Chrubuntu here I come....
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a travel dingy. As a developer, who travels a few times a year, I wanted something that is small and light. My main rig is a Lenovo W520 (two SSD's and a spindle, 24GB RAM) and going through international check points is a pain. This thing has sufficient guts, you can install Ubuntu via Chruton or Chubutnu, and the SSD is fast. It is definitely not a a powerhouse, but for surfing the web, doing email, etc, this thing works well.
customer_reviews.author: meh

customer_reviews.title: This is a good buy
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my wife for when she is doing web based activities. It has been great for browsing the web, watching videos and shopping. The price was definitely right. She has had it for a year and used it every day without any problems. This is not for "heavy lifting" compute-intensive applications but it does a lot of the things that are actually most of one's time on the computer at home.
customer_reviews.author: CheapWhine

customer_reviews.title: Incredible!
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe how awesome the Acer C720 with 4gb is. All the chromebooks should be like this. I had the Samsung Chromebook previously and it was almost unbearable to use. The Acer C720 features the haswell intel processor which is crisp and snappy. I use this device more than my other laptop or desktop. I've noticed that this computer with the 4gb of ram has disappeared recently. That is really disappointing and hopefully they bring it back.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Bell

customer_reviews.title: Great Chromebook!
customer_reviews.text: This was the first chromebook I have used and was a little skeptical at first when purchasing this. That being said, I don't think I'd ever go back to a PC. I can do pretty much anything I want on Chrome OS and everything just seems so smooth. Yes, the trackpad rattles a little bit when clicking and navigating through pages, but it doesn't bother me. I would definitely recommend this chromebook to anyone interested in purchasing one.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Nice feel to the unit
customer_reviews.text: This will probably earn another star, but we have had it only one week. No problems getting it going. Nice feel to the unit. This is our second Chrome book and it seems a bit more study and responsive. The extra memory extends what the unit saves for when we are away from the internet.
customer_reviews.author: Jamber

customer_reviews.title: Happy with my used Acer C720
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Acer C720 after reading a lot of reviews. It is everything that I wanted. It is a used computer but it looks like new. L would have rated it 5 star but sometimes the sound won't work. I did find out how to make it work. When the sound won't work, close the lid of the computer and reopen it . When I do that the sound works every time. This computer is very fast. It dose have good sound and plenty of volume.It plays Netflix movies very well and youtube.
customer_reviews.author: Ragi

customer_reviews.title: False Advertising
customer_reviews.text: The chromebook has many scratches and is missing pieces off the bottom. This looks like it was used for frisbee before being shipped. The description makes it sound like it is basically new. Don't be fooled!! I would have never bought this had I seen pictures beforehand.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Fine laptop just for use, if you don’t have a laptop.
customer_reviews.text: The Chromebook works fine, but no google play store technically not for gaming, not touch screen, and few scratches. That what you get if you buy a Chromebook cheap. 3 Stars.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: meets all the needs
customer_reviews.text: lightweight, portable, fast , great battery life, fast charging. great overall chromebook . my only complaint is the printing options could be better and speakers should have been placed in a different location. this is my first chromebook and im a big google user so it definitely makes sense to have one. it definetly saved me money vs buying a laptop and for what i do i dont need a laptop with all the bells and whistles. the boot up time is amazing and it rarely ever lags while im multitasking lots of apps. definetly recommend but make sure you know that this is a chromebook and not a full fledged computer.
customer_reviews.author: Stefano Piombo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect and priced well!
customer_reviews.text: Son bought it with his bday money and has been using it for a month, and loves it!
customer_reviews.author: susana urquizo

customer_reviews.title: The Best Chromebook for the money PERIOD
customer_reviews.text: It's still hard to find this item at the $249 Amazon price. As of February 2014 the $249 item is usually out of stock. Although there are other sellers offering it for up to $150 MORE. I tried the HP 11 but it was either a lemon or a dog. Watched and waited for the $249 offer then jumped on it. I'm still watching because I'll likely buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Issaquah Washington

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I waited for this specific model because for the longer battery life, more memory, and faster processor. I knew it was going to be fairly good but I had no idea that I'd totally love it! For $249.99 this is amazing! Because of Chrome OS this is a very light weight OS, meaning more available memory is dedicated to the browser. Web pages load faster then my other machines (MacBook and Window Laptop). What really surprised me was that a high end Flash game played way better on this then my other machines. If your time at your computer is spent entirely in your browser, this Chromebook will be a great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Scott A. Conger

customer_reviews.title: Bought it for my mom and it's been great
customer_reviews.text: My mom needed a computer to replace her 2008 Acer Aspire ONE netbook. I was originally thinking an ultrabook or macbook, but then I decided to get her the C720 Chromebook, and I'm very glad I did. This thing is fast and does everything my mom needs it to do and nothing else.. no more phone calls about installing applications, connecting to the internet, etc The chromebook is the future of laptops, most people don't need mobile workstations or gaming computers.
customer_reviews.author: SirGawain

customer_reviews.title: Good for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for the grandkids for online school and zoom. Good, no frills. Serves their purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ultra fast computer
customer_reviews.text: It's my laptop of choice on travel. As I am very Google centric I found it just fine for my needs. I can do a lot of work from Google Docs, Evernote and GMail. Only think it really lacks is Power Point as current Google's version is not up to the task yet. Its more and app than the actual computer.
customer_reviews.author: Roberto Pereira

customer_reviews.title: Would absolutely recommend, and would buy another Acer Chromebook when it ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my wife, who absolutely loves it! So much stuff is done in browser these days, most of the time you can't tell a difference between this and something else. And because it's in browser, it's lightning fast. Would absolutely recommend, and would buy another Acer Chromebook when it comes time to upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: The Salmon's

customer_reviews.title: Great product with compatibility issues
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I am pleased with the performance of this product. The one drawback I am finding is with compatibility. One of the reasons I bought a chromebook was due to the usb connections, which I thought would give us the ability to import pictures from our Dslr camera. Unfortunately, it doesn't recognize the camera, though a work around is to insert the sd card directly into the chromebook. Our camcorder does jot have an sd card so that will present a problem. Overall compatibility continues to be a struggle mainly due to unrecognized file formats. I would rate this product 5 stars if Google can fix the compatibility issues.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: My wife loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this laptop for my wife, she wanted a computer that that would boot-up fast, would be easy to use, and would have wifi for the internet. This computer accomplishes all of the above at a very reasonable price, plus there is no need for internet security programs. I highly recommend this Chromebook to anyone who really wants to use their computer for the internet and simple games.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Maunder

customer_reviews.title: Google has changed the game. $180 for a computer! BUY IT!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this refurbished and when it arrived it had a broken key. I feel like it should have been checked before shipping. Other than that I love this device. It is light and does majority of the functions that I need a computer for. I only have an issue when I have about 30 windows open (do not ask me why I why I need 30 windows). Do not even use my tablet or laptop any more.
customer_reviews.author: Bigchrome

customer_reviews.title: Acer's C720 is a winner
customer_reviews.text: Proud owner of the C720 here. This is my third Chromebook and easily my favorite so far. The extra RAM and Haswell processor give the C720 a much needed boost. The machine is lightweight and portable and it runs like a champ. My only gripe is with the screen...if only Acer gave it the same love Google & HP gave the 11. Still, it's not bad. If you're looking for a Chromebook, I'd recommend either this machine or HP's latest 14-inch model. All other Chromebooks to date including the HP 11 are using outdated hardware and not worth the money despite their low price.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Mcvey

customer_reviews.title: We love it.
customer_reviews.text: Wife can sit anywhere in the house and use it. Small but fast performance. on the kitchen counter for chat or looking up here recipes . much better that her old lap top. We sometimes fight over who gets to use it. the only dislike is the touch pad. real cheap and aggravating to use. we plugged in a small wireless mouse and that fixed our problem. We are older and prefer a mouse. that's the reason for the four star rating .Would recommend, and its a good price for what it does.
customer_reviews.author: Merrill

customer_reviews.title: Good think it was under warranty
customer_reviews.text: I had the product for less than a week and already have to send it to the manufacture for fixing. Good thing it was under warranty! However....maybe it was a good thing I needed to contact the people at Acer...because they had the wrong dates on the warranty. It was suppose to be for a year. They had the expiration date set for 114 days from the time I checked. If you purchase this...CHECK the warranty dates!
customer_reviews.author: cimk

customer_reviews.title: Great machine for internet based use
customer_reviews.text: Great machine for internet based use. Battery life is great, display looks good, boots fast due to the SSD drive, and it runs fast enough for everything I've used it for.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M.Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Another super thumbs up
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. I am a google apps user and it works flawlessly. I think the price is right and is what the netbooks were supposed to be. The only complaint I'd make is that I occasionally make errors in my palm position or other maneuvers and will send an email to draft or other error. But nothing to get too worried about.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew_Android

customer_reviews.title: Love this chromebook
customer_reviews.text: I really love it. I can do everything on this chromebook that I did on my laptop. The only thing I was worried about not being able to do, was burn discs and I sometimes need to do this. I installed crouton and I plugged in my usb dvdrw and it works!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Rose

customer_reviews.title: Best Technological Investment I've made
customer_reviews.text: This is everything I wanted for college and more. No more shoulder aches lugging my previous 6+ # HP, no more 3-hour update screens before shutdowns, no more, omg I'm going to store all my data on this terabyte hard drive I bought for backing up my pc. I know at least 70% of America does not need the clunky laptop they use today (evident from the huge adult and adolescent population with no idea what their pc/tablet/smartphone is capable of aside from checking e-mails and facebook). I think that 70% of them would do themselves (and their wallets) a favor by buying such a beautiful product such as this.
customer_reviews.author: Noah Kim

customer_reviews.title: Too good to be true
customer_reviews.text: Its a good computer but much more wear than advertised Does NOT work with Google play store! Cannot use android apps
customer_reviews.author: kittycas

customer_reviews.title: Best Chromebook
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this needing something I could take to classes for notes and general web browsing and it works great for that. I can also use it to access my desktop which is great for programming classes. In my opinion this is the best Chromebook right now. It has the best performance to cost ratio and it has a nice, understated design. I use it everyday and I can carry it around easily as it is so light. The battery life is also excellent, which is a huge plus.
customer_reviews.author: Connor

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, just like I am used to with my ...
customer_reviews.text: Works fine, just like I am used to with my previous Acer Chromebook. This refurbished item is several years old.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Arthur Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with the Acer C720 Chromebook. Starts fast, runs fast, very thin and light. I timed it to start in about 6 seconds, from a complete shutdown, a second or less from sleep. The only thing so far that I do not like about it, is when you put an SD card in, it doesn't click all the way in, but instead sticks out, about a half inch, out the side, and the trackpad can be slightly sticky. Otherwise, it is a very nice little netbook, and good for anyone who just wants to use the internet.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Sweeney

customer_reviews.title: Great computer, AMAZING software!
customer_reviews.text: I had read a lot of reviews before deciding to purchaise this computer. It is even better than what everyone on the internet is saying. I don't know how people can say that the keyboard and trackpad are not good. They are amazing if you consider the price of the machine. When it comes to the software, which is the most important part of this computer, you have to know what you are getting into. But if you do understand the constraints that you are going to be under the rapid updates and amazing community of owners make using chromeOS a true joy.
customer_reviews.author: MED

customer_reviews.title: Meets a need
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent Chromebook. It's fast and does exactly what a Chromebook is designed to do. It boots up in about 7 seconds and it only takes as long for me to enter my password to be online and surfing. Google apps are getting better and more complete. Does it do everything a laptop does? Of course not, but it does about 95 percent of what i want it to do and it is extremely handy. My only knock, and it's a very small quibble, is that when it's been on for a while and if you are in a very quiet room, you can hea the fan cycling on and off. I highly recommend this system.
customer_reviews.author: James G Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, Good for the purpose
customer_reviews.text: As long as you understand that this is a web-based machine and you can't install things like on traditional laptops, you'll understand that it is good for that use. Also, if you are integrated with Google products, this is easy for use and maintenance of files, email, etc. Quick start up and shut down. Lightweight. Quick charge. Long lasting battery, even with heavy media usage. Biggest con: no Skype but I knew that pre-purchase
customer_reviews.author: Susie Carmichael

customer_reviews.title: This worked out great for my wife who uses it primarily for facebook
customer_reviews.text: This worked out great for my wife who uses it primarily for facebook, email. It's way more effective than a tablet for most of what she does which requires typing. Boots super fast. Only downside I've noticed is the screen could be brighter
customer_reviews.author: mtn rider

customer_reviews.title: Does what I need it to do
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a laptop for browsing and simple everyday use. I really have enjoyed every minute of it. It is fast and responsive, it does everything that I want to do as in email, web browsing, spreadsheets, documents. With a solid state drive it boots up quickly. The only down side that I have found is that it doesn't have a caps lock although I don't use it very often in the first place. Overall I am very pleased with it and it is worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: ItzBerto

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Blend of speed, portability and reliability.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for work and home! Google Drive is my hard drive in the cloud and as long as you use that feature, a Chromebook can do anything you need for basic to intermediate tasks. One suggestion: Next year's model needs a cosmetic makeover. It isn't the prettiest but still stands out.
customer_reviews.author: Demetri Nerris

customer_reviews.title: Go, Speed Acer, Go!
customer_reviews.text: I love my Speed Acer! I bought it with the intention of swapping in a 128g card (), and dual booting Chrubuntu. All of the above works perfectly. I'm using the Acer now to type this review, and couldn't be happier. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic.
customer_reviews.text: My first Chromebook. I bought it for a 10 year old daughter. No worries about viruses. If she breaks it, I won't cry. This is a great laptop to have around the house for Internet access and to stream movies from my media center!
customer_reviews.author: J. Twilley

customer_reviews.title: The mechanical clicking function on the touchpad ceased to work ...
customer_reviews.text: The mechanical clicking function on the touchpad ceased to work after less than a year of use. Clicking and dragging is not possible, but otherwise it does the job two years on.
customer_reviews.author: Kukhri

customer_reviews.title: Great device for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing battery life, great build quality, and the screen is quite nice for the price. Super fast ChromeOS experience! Recommended if you want a lightweight super mobile ChromeOS device.
customer_reviews.author: S. Edlund

customer_reviews.title: Definitely nice
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this chromebook for about a month now and I have found nothing that I can complain about. The battery runs forever (about 7 or 8 hrs) It is very fast and does real good on videos. Great product so far
customer_reviews.author: flyboy19600

customer_reviews.title: Worst!
customer_reviews.text: Looked like kids played with it before I got it. Said refurbished but not much you can do after a gorilla throws it around.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! This little guy is very snappy as all of the reviewers will agree. It's very thoughtful that Acer included 4 GB of RAM in a Chromebook, and you can really feel the difference. The keyboard is great, mouse is touchy and accurate, and the computer feels much more solid than the Samsung. It's a little heavy, but that really gives a reassuring feel to the device. Very pleased, probably one of the best values you're going to find out there.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: 1st laptop and love it!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Boots up superfast, (mere seconds) great compact size but not to compact, looks nice, great price, great sound, love the auto-updating and anti-virus!!! The only thing you may not like it that is does NOT have a slot for you to play DVDS. Other than that, this product is very good and well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Adair Foreman

customer_reviews.title: fast
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my 4 year old laptop with this little one. I am amazed at how fast it is. No more waiting for things to come up. I attached it to a large secondary monitor, but it really wasn't necessary. My daughter insisted. How rapid progress has been!
customer_reviews.author: C. White

customer_reviews.title: Great to Use almost Everywhere I go
customer_reviews.text: I Love the Chromebook, it's easy to use, everything is in one place and I am able to do almost everything through the chromebook, I really like the feel of the keyboard and the way I can take with me all over
customer_reviews.author: gwrider

customer_reviews.title: 4GB machine makes a big difference.
customer_reviews.text: I previously purchased the Samsung Chromebook and returned it. I was not happy with the overall construction of the machine, or the speed of the machine. Surprisingly, the Acer seems to be made better...it just seems more solid. Also, the 4GBs of ram make a huge difference. I think 4GBs should be the minimum standard for Chromebooks. The extra 2 GBs make a huge difference. I can open many tabs without any problems. I can watch video clips on multiple tabs with out any problems. As far as the Chorme OS, I love it. It does what most regular web surfers want it to do, at usually blazing-fast speeds. I am extremely happy with this Chromebook.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip

customer_reviews.title: All I have to say it is the worst item I ever buy from Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Happy with purchase, perfect for LR e-mail and web browsing
customer_reviews.text: Made the perfect choice. This is a very good laptop for what I needed - email, web browsing, youtube, etc. Still getting use to it since I'm a windows person. I can tell you it is fast and the best part - IT BOOTS UP IN 3-4 SECONDS.
customer_reviews.author: DTC

customer_reviews.title: Students love them!
customer_reviews.text: Only wish they were touch screen too! Students are choosing them over HPElitePad 900's with windows 8.1...almost every time. They are fairly lightweight, fairly responsive, and with the Management console, they are easy to manage in the GAFE console....
customer_reviews.author: PAS

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Unit
customer_reviews.text: I love this Chromebook. I got the original 720 that came with 4GB of RAM. Most of what I do is via a Browser and this unit is fast. Better performance than my 1200 dollar Windoze 8.1 laptop.

customer_reviews.title: I like the fact that I can play my Face Book ...
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that I can play my Face Book games on this Laptop. Some of the ones I have tried would not let me play certain games I like. I like the small size and easy handeling of it
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth A. Kathryn Agans

customer_reviews.title: ACER C720 4GB WAS THE RIGHT CHOICE
customer_reviews.text: The Acer C720 4GB is a solid Chromebook. Just the right size for portability and weighs nothing. I gave only 4 stars because the Chrome OS still needs more kinks worked out. For instance printing with a non cloud printer on the network. Even my cellphone will do that function. All Chromebooks suffer from Chrome OS needing further development. With all the updates it can only improve.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Binkley

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful Chromebook, amazingly light and seems well constructed and solid. Runs Ubuntu very nicely ( went the Crouton install after 128 gb replacement drive ).
customer_reviews.author: leonard hodgeman

customer_reviews.title: Good chromebook for the price, but looks cheap.  Screen is not very appealing.
customer_reviews.text: Good chromebook for the price, but looks cheap. Screen is not very appealing. But, for carrying around, it is very light weight and battery really goes long time (6-7 hours of medium use).
customer_reviews.author: Ram

customer_reviews.title: Acer C720 is a Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: I have used my new chromebook ever day since I received it and am very happy with the product. For the price and what I needed it for I think this is the best buy out there. I own a small business and it also serves as a great fast simple device with multiple applications that are business driven. 5 stars all day..

customer_reviews.title: Shipping was great as promised
customer_reviews.text: Had a little scratch on the screen. But for the price it’s worth every dollar

customer_reviews.title: Acer 720 Chromebook
customer_reviews.text: It's so nice to buy a brand new laptop for less them $250. Performance is great! The unit seems very well built and is perfect for surfing the net and sending emails. Great buy!!!
customer_reviews.author: TRUMP 2020

customer_reviews.title: Meets all my expectations
customer_reviews.text: This computer is one of the first chromebooks released with decent computational hardware. The screen, trackpad, and speakers and sufficient, but not fantastic. The biggest room for improvement is within Chrome OS itself. Currently, you cannot upload music to google music, and you cannot unzip password protected files.

customer_reviews.title: Like New!

customer_reviews.title: It is good, but my keypad and built-in mouse are very sensitive
customer_reviews.text: It also will click on occasion when I DO NOT press click. That is rare though, and I am impressed so far with what it does and what i paid for it... good deal!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Tankersley

customer_reviews.title: A Great Ultrabook on a budget
customer_reviews.text: It has been more than a year since I bought it. Since then I have swapped out the SSD with a 128GB one and installed Ubuntu alongside Its ChromeOS. I mostly use it as an Ubuntu Ultrabook and it has been working great.
customer_reviews.author: Bandyo

customer_reviews.title: I Love It
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love it. Not a whole lot of apps yet but they will come. I wish Microsoft would port Office to it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert P

customer_reviews.title: Sold my Macbook for this and I'm never looking back!
customer_reviews.text: Hey you.... yes you.... buy this Chromebook. Some people like to say "Chromebooks are the worst all they are is a web browser." I like to say "Chromebooks are amazing! You should buy one and try it out. If you are worried that you can't run programs like Skype then all you need to do is run linux along side Chrome OS. Its super easy to do. Also if you have a desktop, you can use Chrome Remote Desktop to login to your desktop and run programs. This thing is super fast and doesn't lag on bit when you are streaming multiple video's and music all at the same time." Yep! That's what I like to say.
